H0.text: Dynamic is the state of chemical equilibrium in which both the forward and reverse reactions continue to occur, rather than being static.

H1.text: Abrasive is the term for chemical equilibrium, because both the forward reaction and the reverse reaction continue to occur, so it is not static.

H2.text: Fluid describes chemical equilibrium, where both the forward reaction and the reverse reaction continue to occur, rather than being static.

H3.text: Stable is the term for chemical equilibrium, in which both the forward and reverse reactions continue to occur rather than being static.

A4.text: Such a state is known as dynamic equilibrium.

A5.text: the reaction rates of the forward and backward reactions are generally not zero, but they are equal.
